title: Are 14 inch laptops suitable for gaming purposes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, That is completely dependent on the specifications of that laptop and the games you want to play. Here’s a nice MSI one, albeit pretty expensive and only has a 1060, yet still pretty solid specs. https://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=9SIA24G57M0485&ignorebbr=1&nm_mc=KNC-GoogleMKP-PC&cm_mmc=KNC-GoogleMKP-PC-_-pla-_-Gaming+Laptops-_-9SIA24G57M0485&gclid=Cj0KCQjwzIzWBRDnARIsAAkc8hGkSyG3H1pNAXeu3cdkh6H9apqE0cF8h6Uf_nZTBdhsADd5M81B7-EaAozpEALw_wcB&gclsrc=aw.ds

It depends on what is inside of it and what games you are playing. If you are playing Minecraft, crisis, out any well browser games, then you don't have to worry about anything, but if you are playing games that require higher graphics usage. Then you should look for a laptop with a GPU and a decent processor.

There are actually 14″ Gaming Latops in retail that you can buy, so that will answer you question. All of those have HDMI ports to connect external monitor or TV. So, when you want to go with a larger screen - you can do it.
Sure. As long as they pack at least 8 GB ram and a decent graphics card/ Intel HD 620 graphics, they can run most games at 30–60 fps at low to medium settings.
